skill.name: performance-profiler
skill.description: Analyze code performance patterns and identify optimization opportunities.
skill.summary: Analyze code performance patterns and identify optimization opportunities.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation with code examples. All flagged patterns are documentation snippets showing performance anti-patterns and fixes, not executable code. No actual security risks exist.

content.user_title: Analyze code performance and find optimization opportunities
content.value_statement: Slow code wastes compute resources and frustrates users. This skill identifies inefficient algorithms, memory leaks, and N+1 queries, then provides specific fixes with expected performance gains.
actual_capabilities: Identify O(n²) algorithms and suggest O(n) alternatives
Detect memory leaks from uncleared event listeners
Find unnecessary React or Vue component re-renders
Analyze bundle size and large dependency imports
Provide before and after code examples with expected improvements
limitations: Cannot execute code or measure actual runtime performance
Cannot access external profiling tools or browser DevTools
Analysis is based on code patterns, not production metrics
Cannot modify files or apply fixes automatically

use_cases.title: Fix slow React components
use_cases.description: Identify unnecessary re-renders and apply memoization strategies to improve React performance.

use_cases.title: Optimize database queries
use_cases.description: Detect N+1 query problems and suggest eager loading or join strategies to reduce database calls.

use_cases.title: Reduce JavaScript bundle size
use_cases.description: Find large dependencies like lodash or moment and suggest lighter alternatives or tree shaking.

prompt_templates.title: Basic performance check
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this code for performance issues and suggest improvements.

prompt_templates.title: Algorithm efficiency review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the algorithms in this code. Find any O(n²) or worse patterns and suggest O(n) alternatives.

prompt_templates.title: React component optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this React component for unnecessary re-renders, missing memoization, and memory leaks.

prompt_templates.title: Full performance report
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a complete performance analysis including algorithm efficiency, memory usage, bundle impact, and specific optimizations with code examples.

output_examples.input: Analyze this JavaScript search function for performance
output: Found O(n²) complexity from nested loops
Recommendation: Use Map for O(1) lookups
Expected improvement: 99% faster at ~8ms for 1000 items

output_examples.input: Review this React component for re-render issues
output: Component re-renders on every parent state change
Expensive calculation runs on each render
Recommendation: Add useMemo for expensiveCalculation, wrap with React.memo

output_examples.input: Check my bundle for large dependencies
output: lodash: 71KB gzipped - import only needed functions
moment: 68KB gzipped - replace with date-fns or day.js

best_practices: Profile code before optimizing to identify actual bottlenecks
Focus on high-impact areas first rather than micro-optimizations
Measure performance improvements after implementing changes
anti_patterns: Optimizing code without measuring actual performance impact
Importing entire libraries when only specific functions are needed
Ignoring memory leaks from uncleared event listeners or timers

faq.question: Which programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill works with JavaScript, Python, Java, Go, and most mainstream languages. Analysis focuses on universal performance patterns.

faq.question: Can this skill measure actual runtime performance?
faq.answer: No. The skill analyzes code patterns conceptually. Use browser DevTools, clinic.js, or language-specific profilers for runtime measurements.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with build tools like webpack?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill for AI assistants. It provides analysis recommendations but does not integrate with build systems.

faq.question: Is my code data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. As a prompt-based skill, no code is stored externally. Analysis happens within your AI session context.

faq.question: How is this different from Chrome DevTools or Lighthouse?
faq.answer: This skill analyzes source code patterns statically. DevTools and Lighthouse measure runtime performance. Use both for complete optimization.

faq.question: What types of performance issues can this skill find?
faq.answer: Algorithm inefficiency, memory leaks, unnecessary re-renders, N+1 queries, large bundle dependencies, and blocking operations.
